title: Slap it harder
review:
Karen (ZoÃ« Tapper ) is depressed from her recent stillborn. She wants to divorce John (Ed Speleers) but hasn't found the words, just moving boxes. Because of the onset of a viral outbreak zombie apocalypse, she opts not to mention it. Instead, they are forced to stay inside their apartment except for the occasional food runs. She works in the evidence locker and has a bunch of drugs "they won't miss" lying around.

The film was more drama than horror. It is about two people who have fallen apart finding themselves again. It was all right, just don't expect great zombie effects.

title: Not your average zombie flick.
review:
A nice little romance movie hidden inside a zombie apocalypse comedy. Very enjoyable and well worth a look.
More aimed at the feel good, love story genre than at the zombie market.
A hidden gem doused in British, dry, black comedy.

title: Love survives
review:
Easily one of the better zombie movies out there. Zoo eschews the typical zombie movie cliches and focuses instead on how the end of the world affects a lone couple, already on the brink of a failing marriage. Solid acting by both main characters.

Spoiler . . . . . . . . . . .

. . . . . . . . My only question is why they didn't go out through the hole in the roof.
